definition: (coll.) to fight to the death
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
variant of 嗑[ke4]
to brave it out/to the bitter end
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to meet force with force/painstaking
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to get into a dispute with
to fight with all one has
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: (dialect) to come to blows/to have a row
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
